result.execSummary:
The defendant Loren Dion Rice Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All amounts due are to be paid at a rate of $25 per month commencing January 15, 2023 and the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full. There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

With Huber privileges  consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 
Court authorizes Huber privileges but the decision lies with the jail as to whether Huber release is granted or not. 

Defendant shall contact the Washington County Jail within 3 days for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis. Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.
Consecutive to: any other sentence defendant is serving.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Loren Dion Rice Sr

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Loren Dion Rice Sr in court, in custody. Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Loren Dion Rice Sr.  Attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached for plea with counsel free to argue concurrent vs. consecutive time. Def pleads guilty; is convicted. Argument by counsel on sentence. Statements by Defendant. Defendant sentenced.

Defendant Loren Dion Rice Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Loren Dion Rice Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution anticipated and request for special time for anticipated plea and sentencing. 
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Loren Dion Rice Sr appeared by video from Washington Co Jail, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Loren Dion Rice Sr. Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case passed and recalled. Def now appears in person in custody. Information on file; reading waived; NG PLEA entered.  Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Loren Dion Rice Sr appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Loren Dion Rice Sr. Counsel's first appearance. Def waives prelim; court accepts waiver and binds def over for trial. Arraignment scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Loren Dion Rice Sr appeared by video from Washington Co Jail, in custody. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender. Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.
